text: Can I push new page template files through ftp or do they need to be created from design manager for some metadata to be created?
And can I publish changes while uploading new versions via ftp or do I have to do the publish from design manager?

Nope, you can just push new or overwrite template files with ftp. There are some peculiarities with specific ftp clients though, checkout the docs for this; <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/HubSpot-ftp>
But simply pushing a new .html file doesn't make the template appear in page creation. Whereas if I create a new file via design manager and push changes over that, I can actually use the template
^ I believe you still need to go into the design manager to "publish" that template, or you may be able to do this over API
If you happen to be trying to do a blog or system template, you'll need to make 'em in the design manager first
Otherwise they'll be considered page templates

It's supposed to be a page template and I can't publish it without making some changes first in design manager either. Didn't even realize that there is an option to handle the templates via API. This could've actually been a better solution in the first place for me to look into rather than the ftp
Anyone interested in giving this a whirl? I don’t have much time right now to get this addressed but it’s a fairly annoying issue that requires a small css tweak.
